com.yahoo.sketches.memory

Class AllocMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.sketches.memory.NativeMemory
      • com.yahoo.sketches.memory.AllocMemory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Memory

    public class AllocMemory
extends NativeMemory
    This class is used to allocate memory directly off-heap. It is the responsibility of the calling class to free this memory using NativeMemory.freeMemory() when done.

    The task of direct allocation was moved to this sub-class for performance reasons. (Thanks to Himanshu Gupta for pointing this out.).

    Author:
    Lee Rhodes

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AllocMemory(long capacityBytes)
      Allocates and provides access to capacityBytes directly in native (off-heap) memory leveraging the Memory interface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void finalize()
      If the JVM calls this method and a "freeMemory() has not been called" a System.err message will be logged.
      void freeMemory()
      Frees this Memory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AllocMemory

        public AllocMemory(long capacityBytes)
        Allocates and provides access to capacityBytes directly in native (off-heap) memory leveraging the Memory interface
        Parameters:
        capacityBytes - the size in bytes of the native memory

    • Method Detail

      • freeMemory

        public void freeMemory()
        Description copied from class: NativeMemory
        Frees this Memory. If direct, off-heap native memory is allocated via the AllocMemory sub-class this method must be called in either the NativeMemory class or the AllocMemory class.
        Overrides:
        freeMemory in class NativeMemory

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        If the JVM calls this method and a "freeMemory() has not been called" a System.err message will be logged.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
